events.originalText: A fire broke out in the hills near Valparaíso, Chile, eventually destroying at least 2,500 homes and leaving approximately 11,000 people homeless.
events.subtitle: Great Fire of Valparaíso
events.headline: Fire destroys 2,500 homes near Valparaíso, Chile

events.originalText: Four Chadian soldiers were killed in a suicide bombing by jihadist rebels in Kidal, Mali.
events.subtitle: 2013 Kidal suicide attack
events.headline: Four Chadian soldiers killed in Mali suicide bombing

events.originalText: The Guinea-Bissau military seized control in a coup amid a presidential election, later handing power to a transitional administration under Manuel Serifo Nhamadjo.
events.subtitle: 2012 Guinea-Bissau coup d'état
events.headline: Guinea-Bissau military seizes control in coup

events.originalText: Bosnian War: NATO forces began Operation Deny Flight (aircraft pictured) to enforce a no-fly zone over Bosnia and Herzegovina ordered by the United Nations Security Council.
events.subtitle: Bosnian War
events.headline: NATO forces begin Operation Deny Flight in Bosnia

events.originalText: Harold Washington was elected as the first African-American mayor of Chicago.
events.subtitle: Harold Washington
events.headline: Harold Washington elected first African-American mayor of Chicago

events.originalText: Samuel Doe took control of Liberia in a coup d'etat, overthrowing President William Tolbert and ending over 130 years of national democratic presidential succession.
events.subtitle: Samuel Doe
events.headline: Samuel Doe takes control of Liberia in coup

events.originalText: Canadian athlete Terry Fox embarked on an east-to-west "Marathon of Hope" from St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador, with a prosthetic leg to raise funds for cancer research.
events.subtitle: Terry Fox
events.headline: Terry Fox starts 'Marathon of Hope' for cancer research

events.originalText: Aboard Vostok 1, Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin performed the first human spaceflight, completing one orbit of Earth in 108 minutes.
events.subtitle: Vostok 1
events.headline: Yuri Gagarin performs first human spaceflight aboard Vostok 1

events.originalText: SMS Zrínyi, one of the last pre-dreadnoughts built by the Austro-Hungarian Navy, was launched in Trieste.
events.subtitle: SMS Zrínyi
events.headline: SMS Zrínyi launched by Austro-Hungarian Navy

events.originalText: Confederate forces began bombarding Fort Sumter in the harbor of Charleston, South Carolina, starting the American Civil War.
events.subtitle: Confederate States of America
events.headline: Confederate forces bombard Fort Sumter, starting Civil War

events.originalText: The Broughton Suspension Bridge near Manchester, England, collapsed, reportedly because of mechanical resonance induced by troops marching in step across it.
events.subtitle: Broughton Suspension Bridge
events.headline: Broughton Suspension Bridge near Manchester collapses

events.originalText: Greek War of Independence: Ottoman troops began a massacre of tens of thousands of Greeks (depicted) on the island of Chios.
events.subtitle: Greek War of Independence
events.headline: Ottoman troops massacre Greeks on Chios island

events.originalText: The Froberg mutiny of Greek and Albanian troops in British service ended with the explosion of the gunpowder magazine at Fort Ricasoli, Malta.
events.subtitle: Froberg mutiny
events.headline: Froberg mutiny ends with explosion at Fort Ricasoli, Malta

events.originalText: American Revolution: The North Carolina Provincial Congress passed the Halifax Resolves, the first official action in the American colonies calling for independence from Great Britain.
events.subtitle: American Revolution
events.headline: North Carolina Congress passes Halifax Resolves for independence

events.originalText: Troops of the Fourth Crusade entered Constantinople and began a sack of the city, temporarily dissolving the Byzantine Empire.
events.subtitle: Fourth Crusade
events.headline: Fourth Crusade sacks Constantinople, dissolving Byzantine Empire
